questions.text: In the last month, how many times did you look at your Profit & Loss report?

options.label: I looked at it, but not sure when

questions.text: How current is your bookkeeping?
When did you last reconcile your bank account?

options.label: Never / I'm not sure what this means

questions.text: Are your business tax returns filed and current?
Do you track money owed to you AND bills you need to pay?

options.label: Yes, both tracked manually (spreadsheet or paper)
I track one but not the other

questions.text: Are your personal finances and business finances completely separate?
Do you have a clear picture of any business debts and when payments are due?

options.label: Yes, I know it in my head
Somewhat — I know the big ones

questions.text: Does your business have emergency cash reserves?
Do you set aside money for taxes throughout the year (estimated tax payments)?

options.label: Yes, automatically transferred to a separate account
Yes, I manually set money aside regularly
No, I deal with it at tax time

questions.text: When you notice something's off with your finances, what do you usually do first?

options.label: Handle it right away — quick action
Talk it through with my bookkeeper, partner, or advisor
Take time to understand the full picture before acting
Dig into the details and research what's happening
None of these fit me well

questions.text: What's your business structure?
Do you pay yourself a regular salary through payroll?
What do you use to manage your finances?

options.label: QuickBooks, Xero, or similar full software

questions.text: Do your business systems talk to each other (like sales updating accounting automatically)?

options.label: N/A — I don't have multiple systems

questions.text: If you have inventory, how do you track it?
Where do you keep important financial documents?

options.label: Paper files, hard to find things

questions.text: Are your income and expense categories in your books organized in a way that makes sense for you and your business?

options.label: Yes, customized and meaningful for my business

questions.text: How do you typically work with vendors and suppliers?

options.label: I negotiate hard and focus on getting the best deal
I build relationships — they're flexible because we work well together
I stick with reliable vendors I trust, even if not cheapest
I document everything and track all contracts carefully
None of these fit me well

questions.text: When setting up a new financial process (like how invoices get sent), you prefer:

options.label: Keep it simple — just get it working
Get input from the team so everyone's on board
Use a proven approach that's worked before
Think through every detail and document it thoroughly
None of these fit me well

questions.text: Do you have written guides or checklists for regular financial tasks?

options.label: Mostly in my head, but I could explain it
Mostly in my head, hard to explain

questions.text: Do you work from a budget?

options.label: Yes, detailed budget I review regularly
Yes, basic budget I check occasionally

questions.text: In the last quarter, how many times did you compare what you actually spent vs. what you planned?

options.label: I thought about it but didn't formally compare

questions.text: Do you have a process for approving bigger purchases?

options.label: N/A — All decisions are mine alone

questions.text: Do you have safeguards to catch mistakes or prevent fraud?

options.label: Yes, solid controls (different people handle different tasks)
N/A — Just me, no one else touches finances

questions.text: When a financial decision needs to be made (like a significant purchase), you typically:

options.label: Decide quickly if it makes sense — no need to overthink
Discuss it with people I trust before deciding
Think about how it affects stability and people
Analyze the numbers and ROI before committing
None of these fit me well

questions.text: Which of these have you automated?

options.label: Bank transactions syncing to your books

questions.text: How do you prefer to see your financial information?

options.label: Dashboard with key numbers — quick snapshot
Visuals I can discuss with my team or advisor
Consistent reports in the same format each time
Detailed reports with all the underlying numbers
None of these fit me well

questions.text: What kind of business do you run?
How long have you been in business?
About how much does your business bring in each year?
How many people work in your business?
Do you predict how much money will be coming in and going out?

options.label: Occasionally, when something big is coming up

questions.text: Do you plan for different scenarios (like "what if sales drop 20%")?
Do you know which of your products or services are most profitable?

options.label: Yes, I track this in detail
Yes, I have a general sense
I've thought about it but haven't tracked it

questions.text: Do you plan ahead for big purchases (equipment, vehicles, expansion)?
Do you have a strategy for funding growth (loans, investors, profits)?

options.label: Doesn't feel relevant for my business right now

questions.text: When predicting future revenue, you rely mostly on:

options.label: Gut instinct and confidence in my ability to make it happen
Conversations with customers, partners, and my network
What's worked consistently in the past
None of these fit me well

questions.text: Do you understand what your financial statements are telling you?

options.label: Understand it on a basic level
I get my reports regularly but it's a foreign language

questions.text: If your profit margin dropped 10% this month, would you know why?

options.label: Yes, I could identify the cause quickly
I'd figure it out with a little digging
I'd need help figuring it out
I wouldn't notice until much later

questions.text: Do you know how much revenue you need each month to cover all your expenses (your break-even point)?

options.label: Yes, I know the exact number
I've thought about it but never calculated

questions.text: Do you know which financial metrics matter most for YOUR type of business?
Do you set financial goals and track progress toward them?

options.label: Yes, specific goals with regular tracking

questions.text: Have you helped your team understand the financial side of the business?
How do you approach setting business goals?

options.label: Set ambitious targets and push to hit them
Create goals together with my team or partners
Build detailed plans with specific milestones
None of these fit me well

questions.text: When learning something new about managing business finances, you prefer:

options.label: Quick tips I can apply immediately
Learning through conversation or group discussion
Step-by-step guidance at my own pace
None of these fit me well

questions.text: On a scale of 1 to 5, how confident do you feel about understanding your business's overall financial health?
Looking back at your answers in this assessment, does anything surprise you about where you are?

options.label: No — I knew where I stood
A little — some things to think about
Yes — I have more work to do than I thought
I'm not sure what to think
